attributes.additional_details: I am a pre-op transwoman who has continually been denied access to the women's toilet because I am still physically male. This is surely a violation of my right to choose, my right to no discrimination, etcetera.
attributes.background: I want the Government to alter the law to allow all people to use the toilet that matches their Gender Identity

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Government guidance already sets out that "a trans person should be free to select the facilities (such as toilets or changing rooms) appropriate to the gender in which they present."

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/484857/Providing_services_for_transgender_customers-a_guide.pdf

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
